fields.title: Forum rules, please read before posting
fields.data:
This forum is for getting help with the new Firefox Home App for iPhone.  It's not for getting help with other mobile versions of Firefox (for that see [http://mobile.support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/|our mobile support site]) or for the desktop/laptop/netbook version of Firefox (for that, use our [/forum/|regular support forum].

Before posting in the forum, please check the following:

* You have installed the __Mozilla__ Firefox Home app.  There may be other apps with similar names or functionality, however, we can only provide support for the official Mozilla one.
* You try the steps in the ((Firefox Home does not work)) article including trying a ((Firefox Home does not work|#Complete_refresh|complete refresh of your data)).

When posting, please let us know the following:

* What version of iPhone OS are you running
* What model iPhone do you have (3G, 3GS, 4 etc)
* How much data you are expecting to sync (roughly how many bookmarks and tabs you have)
* Any URLs or other information that may be helpful in reproducing the problem.

This will help us isolate the problem you may be seeing so we can provide suggestions or fix things in future versions of the app.

Thanks for using Firefox Home!

fields.title: Websites that don't work in Firefox Home
fields.data:
If you run across a website that won't display in Firefox Home please reply to this tread and give us the URL. It will also be helpful if you can try it in Mobile Safari and let us know if it worked or not.

If the website requires a login we won't be able to test it unless we can create an account. So this means we probably can't test your company's private site. Please don't post your username and password in the forum.

Thanks!

fields.title: Firefox Home is missing support for own server setups
fields.data:
While Firefox Sync is itself comming with instructions on how to setup an own sync/weave server, the "Firefox Home" client for iPhone doesn't seem to allow to enter the servername manually so that own server setups are currently not support in version 1.0.

I highly opt for integrating a possibility to specify the servername for an own sync/weave server because otherwise the sync client is not useable for users running their own server. And as Firefox Home is open source it should provide the same functionality like the firefox sync client in firefox itself.

fields.title: Port to Andriod
fields.data: This would be useful for keeping my HTC Desire uptpdate with Firefox.

fields.title: Firefox Home initial sync crashes if viewing Settings tab
fields.data:
!! Issue
I have another kind of problem with Firefox

!! Description
Upon installation on my 3G, I set up my user info(no uppercase or symbols as in other threads), and was flipping through the various screens to have a look around, eventually leaving the app on the Settings tab. After several minutes of no visible progress, it crashed out and had no data when I relaunched. I've replicated the crashing behavior several times. On one occasion, some(but not all) data was downloaded.

If the app is left on the first screen, the initial sync seems to work fine. I haven't tried other screens.

The crashing doesn't seem to recur on later syncs.

!! This happened
Every time Firefox opened

!! Firefox version
3.6.6

!! Operating system
Windows Vista

!! User Agent
Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.0; en-US; rv:1.9.2.6) Gecko/20100625 Firefox/3.6.6

!! Plugins installed
*-The QuickTime Plugin allows you to view a wide variety of multimedia content in Web pages. For more information, visit the QuickTime Web site.
*NPRuntime Script Plug-in Library for Java(TM) Deploy
*Default Plug-in
*Google Update
*Shockwave Flash 10.1 r53
*iTunes Detector Plug-in
*4.0.50524.0
*Version 1.0.3, copyright 1996-2009 The VideoLAN Teamhttp://www.videolan.org/
*Next Generation Java Plug-in 1.6.0_20 for Mozilla browsers
fields.summary: Firefox version: 3.6.6 Operating system: Windows Vista

fields.title: Comment on thread 727465
fields.data:
Actually, Mozilla is working on a mobile version of Firefox that you will be able install on Android, and that will have the sync add-on (perhaps built-in).
See https://wiki.mozilla.org/Mobile/Platforms/Android

fields.title: Comment on thread 727433
fields.data:
Here's the official word:

We definitely want to enable this as quickly as we can. Supporting users running their own servers is very much a part of our core service
principles. We have a bug open to track this: [https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=579247]. Please follow that bug for more details and updates.

fields.title: Comment on thread 727433
fields.data: Firefox Home didn't ship with a custom server URL option, [https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=579247|but there's a bug filed on this issue and a patch to fix it is underway].
